sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>spoon</radical> to measure a <radical>geoduck</radical> is a very <kanji>approximate</kanji> measurement. Geoducks are big, spoons are small. Still, we'll get the approximation going, right?
meaningInfo: Do the comparison. A spoonful of geoduck aka a whole geoduck on a spoon. This is a spoonful, right? This is what the recipe wanted, I think...
readingMnemonic: Maybe this is too much geoduck, even if we're going for an <kanji>approximate</kanji>. So, you take the <reading>core</reading> (<ja>ころ</ja>) of the geoduck and measure that instead.
readingInfo: That's a little better. Not too much geoduck. Still a lot, but more like an approximate.
